entry.title: Link to MathVault’s glossary
entry.summary: Do you usually find yourself puzzled by mathematical symbols and jargon? You are not alone! Owing to the field I work on, I encounter mathematical jargon from time to time. Here is the link to the Mathematical glossary by Mathvault that I like to keep handy.

entry.title: You and Your research. Advice to researchers by R W Hamming

link.title: You and Your research. Advice to researchers by R W Hamming

entry.content: Redirecting to a pdf from OSU website.
entry.summary: The most important part of research is attacking an attackable research problem worth attacking. Most people know it, and yet most of us ignore it. I like the lecture "You and your research" by Prof. Hamming that talks about it. You may find the complete lecture video on YouTube and a concise text version at the link above.

entry.title: Derivation of 1D model for tape springs

link.title: Derivation of 1D model for tape springs

entry.summary: A zip file containing three Mathematica files that explains the derivation of the tape spring model. The files are self-explanatory and should be read with the tape spring paper for details.
